website_summaries.verdict: Last generation Surface Pro has a speedy processor and can save you some money, but be prepared for performance compromises and lack of features found in the newest model. Better bang for your buck with the new model.
pros: Despite the last-generation display, users like the display, citing it as sharp and vibrant
Users also enjoyed using it for portability and note-taking
cons: Numerous users advised to save up for the newer Pro 4, preferring the newer model's next-gen processor for demanding apps and games
Also: Microsoft doesn't include the keyboard, though it's "kind of mandatory" according to many users

customer_reviews.title: Love the Product - IF IT WORKED!  Service is Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I will NEVER buy a Microsoft product again. I LOVED my Surface Pro 3 (SP3). But within 8 months the Hard Drive started screeching. When I FINALLY got to MS Support, they said, "we'll send you a replacement SP3." Great, that is great. The replacement would not hold a charge for even 10 hrs with almost no use and wouldn't even turn on 1/2 the time. The Customer Support rep had the guts to say, "That is normal for the SP3." I vehemently disagreed. After 2 weeks of them "trouble shooting" and me NOT having a SP3 to use, they finally said they would send ANOTHER replacement. Let's hope this one actually works.
customer_reviews.author: la law

customer_reviews.title: The surface Pro is the greatest piece of technology I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The surface Pro is the greatest piece of technology I have ever owned. I work in IT - have done for 17 years. I spend long days working on my computer which is a laptop with an i7 processor and 8 GB RAM. The surface pro easily competes with it. I have owned pretty much every iteration of tablet/laptop combo, including iPads, Galaxy tabs etc. this beats them ALL hands-down. I can honestly say I will never buy a laptop again. I am not a gamer, and I haven't tried playing games on the Surface, so not sure how well it would handle that. But for business use, this is the device to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen stopped working after very little use...
customer_reviews.text: welp...I bought my surface pro 3 in December 2014, shortly after it was released. worked great. when Windows 10 came out I did the free upgrade. only used it a few times until recently (May 2017) when finally started to use it regularly. I noticed weird pixel images on the touch screen that looked like bubbles. took it too the Microsoft store and it's an out-of-warranty hardware issue. cannot. be. fixed. it still works fine with the keyboard, but the touchscreen has to be disabled. pretty disappointing. it's basically a laptop now. oh well. I'll upgrade to a surface pro 4 at some point. it's still the nicest tablet/laptop combo out there.
customer_reviews.author: Oaktree

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought it in store
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother, and given how its so much cheaper on Amazon than on Best Buy, I chose to buy it here. However, I then noticed that it does not work as smoothly as my surface pro 2 or my friend's surface pro 3 (both bought from BB or Microsoft Store in store respectively). There are several problems with this product, that started showing up a month after I bought it and continued on. It won't turn on properly. It won't recognize the keyboard properly. I can't rename files I downloaded into the computer. It does not work with Google Chrome And its constant freeze

customer_reviews.title: A nice size computer and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: A nice size computer and fun to use, but unfortunately it has display issues, as it can lock up to a black screen during updates or hibernation. This issue is known by Microsoft, but to my knowledge they have not corrected it. Repairs for this issue have many MS and other postings, but sometimes only expensive repairs are necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Sick of the starting problem.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, useful tablet, except for when it won't turn on. Within a month of my initial purchase, I needed my Pro replaced as it wouldn't turn on anymore. No biggie, except now the replacement won't turn on, after 1.5 years of building up files on it. Until Microsoft can actually fix this problem, stay clear of Surface Pros.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Surface Pro 3
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Surface Pro 3 for about a month and a half now, and I absolutely love it! I was a little hesitant buying it because I was scared the memory would run out. I have came up with an easy solution to that fear - flash drives! It is very easy to use and is set up exactly like a normal windows laptop. I bought it for school because it is light and easy to take with me places.

customer_reviews.title: Great, but a lot of models have faulty microSD slots
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it 3 for right now. Everything about it is true, very nice machine. However I only had used it for 24 hours when I discovered the microSD slot did not work. This was a big issue since I needed more space. I tried 3 different cards, all different manufacturers and none worked. I researched and other users say this is a common problem and just need to get it replaced. So I'm sending it back. If I could review Amazon I would, just wanted to swap it out but I have to get it refunded and order it again.

customer_reviews.title: The best laptop/Tablet I have ever used!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the single most useful device I have ever owned! I use it EVERY SINGLE DAY as my tablet, laptop, textbook(college), and as my note-taking device for school. It goes with me almost everywhere(work, school, when visiting family...etc).I absolutely love taking notes with onenote and the pen. Not only has it changed the way I study, but it has also made me more efficient with multitasking..etc. I am in love with my surface and I am SO glad that I bought it! Thank you to whichever brilliant mind decided to put a tablet and a powerful laptop all in one with a stylus pen. You're a genius!!

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great multi tool for every task
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great multi tool for every task, but it flawed in not being "Great" at every task. Do not regret my decision on buying this for drawing and social management. The pen works well. It's a good pen, and it works fine, but it's not a great pen. The biggest problem with the pen is the lack of support for pressure sensitivity on software such as gimp. The screen is crisp and clear and the multi-gesture touch support works great with most browsers and software, but not all of them. I suggest buying a case. I have dropped mine twice from a counter-top onto a hard floor. Only a little chip off of the counter of the metal.

I would recommend this seller to everyone too. Free shipping and a guaranteed original product.

customer_reviews.title: I do not like Windows 8 (I'm getting used to it)

There are a few things that I don't like, but I really can't complain about this machine. Fast. Powerful. Very, very compact. I love it. 128 GB does not get you very far these days, but whatever. I love it. Got mine for the neighborhood of $720. I'm military so I can get a lot of free software -- so, no need to load it up with pricy Office and Acrobat products. customer_reviews.title: Cautious about the Windows 10 upgrade

I was disappointed in the upgrade to Windows 10. the download went well, no issues but after the upgrade the touchscreen was choppy and non-responsive. I uninstalled Windows 10 and went back to 8.1 and things returned to normal. I think I would have like Windows 10 but couldn't live with the non-responsive, choppy touch screen, really defeats the purpose of a tablet. I have been apprehensive about trying the upgrade a second time. I don't want to get stuck with a non-functional, expensive paperweight for my desk.

customer_reviews.title: Surface Pro3 are great items but you do get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Surface Pro3 are great items but you do get what you pay for. Spend $1K to $1,200 and get the i5, 4GIGs RAM and 256GIG HD (128GIG HD if using for a POS). Microsoft considers this to be a disposable item.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a laptop replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Surface Pro 3 i5/128 GB model yesterday and it came in today. Let me tell you, it definitely is a laptop replacement. I love it. It does everything my 2013 Toshiba Satellite could do. I was a little nervous about the 4 GB of RAM, but then I installed the Steam app and I was able to download Skyrim and Divinity: Original Sin and the Surface could handle them just fine. I will never buy another traditional laptop again now that I've been acquainted with the Microsoft Surface Pro tablets.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for students
customer_reviews.text: +Light weight +Full Windows 8.1 included (not some lighter tablet version) +Powerful enough for everyday stuff, I even use mine for writing programs in Visual Studios and R (no problem) +OneNote integration is really convenient and help full +Touch screen and pen are really nice and accurate. Screen is also really nice to look at and very crisp picture +Official key pad is high quality +Great battery life -Touch pad on official key pad sucks -Hard drive is limited, I would get the 256 gb model Over all really great device, especially for students. This is the only thing I ever have to take to class now.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Garcia

customer_reviews.title: If you have a problem out of warranty repairs are hard to find.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a problem with it getting it fixed is almost impossible. Motherboard failed and no one wants to repair it due to the problem with removing the screen. It seems that the screen has a high probability of breaking during removal. Buy a real laptop that you can repair. This Surface Pro 3 is now a very expensive boat anchor.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gould

customer_reviews.title: Buying multiple its that great
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE the surface pro. We are converting our whole company to Surface Pro 4's because of its ease of use, processing speed and convenience. If you are looking for a tablet that works like a computer or a computer that is the size of a tablet then check this out. The keyboard was extra and we purchased a stylus because the one that came with it wasn't very good.

customer_reviews.title: All Around Great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Computer! It has been a year now since I bought this computer. Nothing has deteriorated, nothing has broken, not a single issue in any regard. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to get a faster, lighter, and more attractive computer.

customer_reviews.title: Great computer -- power supply not so much
customer_reviews.text: In general I like the SP3 very much. One complaint is that the AC cord fits so loosely into the power supply body that it won't stay plugged in or make reliable contact. Since I had a previous one with the same problem, I fixed it by rubber banding the plug on the AC cord to the power supply body. It's too bad such a rinky-dink retrofit is needed to make a new $80 power supply work, but it does the job. Also a minor software issue - it really does not like to log onto GOOGLE.COM from Internet Explorer. A little more net neutrality is needed there.
customer_reviews.author: George Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: NICE.............
customer_reviews.text: Tried the AMAZON FIRE HDX8.9 Too limiting ok if you just want it for games and movies... Tried the SAMSUNG GALAXY TAB S 8.4 Better but just too much money to play games.... Tried MICROSOFT Surface PRO 3, should have started here... It is a good combination of work and play I think. It is a bit pricier but you get much more for your money so worth the extra cost, plus you are not LOCKED into just google and android... I needed it for work, home, and some play. So like I said a good balance. If you just want it for games and movies then you should prob go with the FIRE or GALAXY.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product; it makes note taking a lot more fun via the OneNote app. However, it sucked buying everything separately. Love love love love it. THE only downside of this product is that a 8-9 hour battery life is advertised... this may be true if the setting, like the screen, was tweaked down to a very low screen brightness value; I get maybe 4-5 hours of battery life at recommended settings, during the constant usage with WiFi and Bluetooth turned on.

I am a nursing student, and this is perfect for me. The keyboard with surface pro 3 is a little bigger, and for me that is a plus. It can sit up at a slight angle, and that helps so much! I still love my SP2, my teenager uses it now. I am in love with my new SP3. The slightly bigger screen makes a big difference.

I am glad that I purchased this fantastic tablet.

It does get HOT, but for the size of the processer in such a small package, what do you expect??? I use mine for note taking in college and it has made it so much easier than lugging around a huge laptop along with my books. So compact, but still with all the capablility of my other PC.
customer_reviews.author: n-o-sent

customer_reviews.title: All for one and one of this all in one!
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan! I was not sure if this computer/laptop/tablet choice would be best for me but I have to say, I am very happy with the purchase. The Surface with keyboard is portable but easy to use as a laptop. For my basic computing needs; email, office, browsing etc.... it its just what I needed and it is great to use as a tablet while lazing on the couch! I also use this for a couple college classes that I take at night and I love the pen and note taking features. All in all a great all in one...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet because I wanted a Windows tablet that really CAN replace one's laptop. This Surface Pro 3 really does fit the bill. It is fast, lightweight & [portable, and reliable. The 12" display is much easier to work with than the 10" and it's nice having a sturdy Windows 8 device. IT's pretty intuitive to use. The pen synced quickly and I bought a red type cover to use the keyboard, which is an excellent addition. So far, no complaints here!

It has more than exceeded her expectations. I think we made a good choice.

customer_reviews.title: Light, versatile easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Came in 3 days, was very easy to set up and start using, We use it for Electronic ambulance reporting and it is versatile enough to use on the go and not as heavy as the recommended toughbooks. Thanks for the great customer service.

customer_reviews.author: Darren Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet EVER!!!

As much as I hate MS, great job on this piece of hardware... your operating system still sucks but the MS Pro 3 is a hit with me.

Makes school much easier with the tools and functionality of this devise.

product_meta.description:
SURFACE PRO 3
THE TABLET THAT CAN REPLACE YOUR LAPTOP.
Surface Pro 3 is in a category of its own. With a stunning 12" display in a sleek magnesium frame, Surface Pro 3 has all the power and performance of a laptop in an incredibly lightweight, versatile form. It may just be the ultimate device.*


THE POWER AND PERFORMANCE OF A LAPTOP
The razor-sharp clarity of the 12" Full HD Plus screen combined with a multi-position Kickstand, keyboard*, and multiple ports make Surface Pro 3 an exceptional device for getting work done. The 4th generation Intel Core processor gives you the power to run your favorite desktop software like Microsoft Office and Adobe Photoshop.†


THE BEST OF A TABLET
Weighing in at 1.76 lbs and only 9.1mm thin with up to 9 hours of battery life#, Surface Pro 3 is the perfect tablet for taking between classes, meetings, and on the road. The bright, responsive touchscreen, speakers with Dolby audio, and two 1080p cameras make video-conferencing or watching movies better than ever.


RUNS WINDOWS 8.1 PRO & OFFICE
With Windows 8.1 Pro, you can multitask by running up to three apps side by side. Purchase a 1-year subscription to Office 365 Personal and get Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Outlook as well as 1TB of OneDrive online storage and 60 world minutes per month of Skype‡.


GREAT PEN EXPERIENCE
With a Pen that feels like an actual pen, this is the most natural writing experience on a tablet. With the click of the Pen, a blank sheet is available for writing and drawing, even if the device is asleep. Use the Pen to mark up presentations, sign documents, or enjoy art apps.






ACCESSORIES

SURFACE PRO 3 TYPE COVER
Work the way you’re used to working with the Type Cover designed for Surface Pro 3.


OFFICE 365
Get your favorite applications like Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and OneNote and get work done virtually anytime, anywhere. Plus 1TB OneDrive online storage.


SURFACE PRO 3 DOCKING STATION
Transform your ultraportable Surface Pro 3 into a complete desktop workstation in an instant and easily connect to your favorite accessories.
